The claim made by President Donald Trump: 2. The Nielsen Company reported that 45.6 million Americans above the age of 2 tuned into the president's address across 12 networks between 9 and 10:30 p.m.
However: it was found that this viewership number was not a record, as several previous State of the Union addresses had higher viewership, including addresses by George W. Bush, Bill Clinton, and Barack Obama.
The White House clarified that when Trum: highest number in history," he was referring to cable news history, excluding his own Joint Address to Congress in 2017 and only including the three major cable networks (CNN, Fox News Network, and MSNBC).
